text: thumb Kris James is an English singer-songwriter from Liverpool, England. He was the former lead singer of The Scheme, but now performs as a solo artist. ==Career== After performing as the lead singer of the boyband The Scheme, Liverpool born singer-songwriter Kris James launched his solo career in mid 2018. His debut single "Eyes Open" peaked at number 25 in the official iTunes chart where it held the position for four weeks. The follow-up single "Anymore" was released in the Autumn of 2018 and entered the official iTunes at number 1 in the genre of electronic on the day of release. James' third single "I'll be Here" peaked at number 19 in the official overall iTunes charts. The song was produced by Tom Fuller, who is best known for his work with Amy Winehouse and Robbie Williams. ==Discography== ===The Scheme=== *"Dust" – Single – 2015 *"Jordan's Smile" – charity single – 2015 *Jerome Heights – EP – 2016 ===As solo artist=== * "Eyes Open" – 2018 * "Anymore" – 2018 * "I'll Be Here" – 2019 * "Get Back To Love" – 2019 ==References== Category:Living people Category:English male singer-songwriters Category:Musicians from Liverpool Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Kris James
